New Records: Zack Wheeler reached his 100th career win
Key Match Events: Zack Wheeler stifled the Braves over seven scoreless innings in a 3-0 victory
Edmundo Sosa and Trea Turner each went deep to provide more than enough support for Wheeler
Pre-Game Insights: The battle for the NL Cy Young Award appears to be a two-man race between NL East aces for the time being
Wheeler has an NL-best 0.98 WHIP -- ahead of Sale's 1.02 -- and also holds the edge in innings (167 2/3 to 153 2/3) and starts (27 to 25)
Post-Match Reflections: Wheeler said. “It’s special,” Wheeler said. “No. 1 was against these guys and No. 100 was against these guys. … It’s been a long road, and just hard work and believing in myself and believing in the teams that I’ve been on.”
Miscellaneous Highlights: The win -- Philadelphia's 80th of the season -- pushed the club's NL East lead over Atlanta to six games with 26 remaining -- including just one more head-to-head meeting on Sunday night
Wheeler has held the opposition to two runs or fewer in 16 of his past 18 starts
